report.title: Charles II, 1677 & 1678
report.subtitle: Chapter VI. An Act for reviveing a former A&bholigct; entituled An A&bholigct; for avoiding unnecessary Suits and Delayes and for continuance of one, other A&bholigct; entituled An A&bholigct; for the better settleing of Intestates Estates.[Rot. Parl.30 C.II.p.I.nu.6.]

section.head: 17 C.II. c. 8. 22 & 23 C. II. C.10.
section.para: Whereas one A&bholigct; of this present Parlyament entituled An A&bholigct; for avoiding unnecessary Suites and Delayes, and alsoe one other A&bholigct; entituled An A&bholigct; for the better setleing of Intestates Estates have beene found to be very beneficiall Bee it ena&bholigct;ed by the Kings, most Excellent Majestie by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spirituall and Temporall and Commons in this present Parlyament assembled and by Authoritie of the same That the said A&bholigct;s of Parlyament shall be in force from the First day of this present Session of Parlyament and soe to continue for seaven yeares and from thence to the end of the next Session of Parlyament and noe longer.
